comments.body: ... to match the format of similar example data, like the SVD example data.

@srowen Do you think we should change the format from 

```
<L>,<f1> <f2> ...
```

to

```
<L> <f1> <f2> ...
```

(replace `,` by ` `) to be consistent with LIBSVM format. And eventually we may support multi-label, in which case we can use

```
<l1>,<l2> <f1> <f2>
<l1>,<l2>,<l3> <f1> <f2>
```

OK by me. I don't recognize this format, although it was similar to what's in `lpsa.data` (minus the apparent extra space?) so I made it similar to that. I didn't see other uses of this file anyway. Since you suggest an extension to this comma-based format, is it something known that needs to be preserved rather than changed? What about changing `lpsa.data` then?

Replacing `,` by ` `in`lpsa.data`. Just try to be consistent with LIBSVM format, which label and features are separated by` `instead of`,`. Comma can be used as label delimiter, for multi-label classification, where an example may have multiple labels. For LIBSVM, this is

```
1,2 1:1.0 3:4.0
```

For dense data, we can use

```
1,2 1.0 0.0 4.0
```
Got it, so you think I should change both files to remove the commas, so that they are consistent with libsvm format? In both cases there is just one label / predicted value.

Maybe we should do that in a separate PR, because `MLUtils#loadLabeledData` and `MLUtils#saveLabledData` need to be updated as well. I really want to find names better describing those two functions, since they only work for dense data.
